item.title: 对冲基金博弈日元疲软
item.description: 日本支撑日元疲软的压力可能已经减弱，但货币疲软仍是东京头疼的问题。【原文：Pressure on Japan to prop up a weak yen may have ebbed, but currency weakness remains a headache for Tokyo.】

item.title: 独家报道文件显示，上海编制了符合加快海外转移条件的数据清单
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一份政府文件，上海已经编制了一份无需安全评估即可向海外传输数据的清单，这是中国试图吸引外资以提振疲软经济的一个备受期待的举措。【原文：Shanghai has compiled a list of data that can be transferred overseas without security assessments, according to a government document seen by Reuters, a much anticipated move as China tries to lure foreign investment to boost a sluggish economy.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，丰田在墨西哥工厂多次停工，原因是供应商遭遇工人短缺
item.description: 据了解丰田汽车运营情况的人士称，由于当地劳动力短缺，供应商的产量受阻，丰田汽车被迫在 2 月和 3 月多次停止墨西哥工厂的生产。【原文：Toyota Motor was forced to repeatedly halt production at a Mexico plant in February and March after local labour shortages snarled output at suppliers, according to people with knowledge of the automaker's operations.】

item.title: 通胀忧虑消退，投资者将资金投入股票和债券 - 美国银行称
item.description: 美国银行（BofA）周五的研究显示，在截至本周三的一周内，投资者将资金投入股票和债券市场，青睐公用事业股等落后股票，但从科技股等市场价格较高的股票中撤出资金。【原文：Investors poured money into stocks and bonds in the week to Wednesday, favouring laggards such as utilities, but pulling money from pricier parts of the market such as technology stocks, BofA research showed on Friday.】

item.title: 日元疲软打击消费支出，日本央行或面临更大加息压力
item.description: 日本的消费疲软可能会加剧而不是减轻对央行的政治压力，迫使央行提高利率，以减缓日元的跌势，因为进口成本的增加会损害家庭的利益。【原文：Japan's weak consumption may heighten, rather than tame, already growing political pressure on the central bank to raise interest rates to slow the yen's declines blamed for hurting households via higher import costs.】

item.title: 葛兰素史克通过折价出售 Haleon 股份融资 15 亿美元
item.description: 英国制药商葛兰素史克周五表示，该公司已通过出售其在消费者保健公司 Haleon 的全部剩余股份筹集了 12.5 亿英镑（15.2 亿美元）的资金。【原文：GSK has raised 1.25 billion pounds ($1.52 billion) from selling its entire remaining stake in consumer healthcare firm Haleon, the British drugmaker said on Friday.】

item.title: 预计中国 5 月贷款利率将保持不变
item.description: 路透社的一项调查显示，人们普遍预计中国将在周一保持基准贷款利率稳定，不过，随着中国政府努力刺激住房需求，人们对下调抵押贷款基准利率的预期也在增加。【原文：China is widely expected to hold benchmark lending rates steady on Monday, a Reuters survey showed, although expectations are growing for a cut in the mortgage reference rate as the authorities scramble to boost housing.】

item.title: 英国杂货商塞恩斯伯里公司与微软合作，利用人工智能洞察数据
item.description: 英国森斯伯瑞公司周五表示，它已与微软达成了一项为期五年的战略合作伙伴关系，将利用微软的人工智能能力和超市集团的丰富数据。【原文：Britain's Sainsbury's said on Friday it has agreed a five-year strategic partnership with Microsoft that will use the technology company's artificial intelligence capabilities and the supermarket group's rich data.】

item.title: 日本通胀可能再度放缓，成本压力或将缓解
item.description: 周五，路透社对 18 位经济学家进行的调查显示，日本 4 月份的核心消费通胀可能连续第二个月环比放缓，成本推动压力可能有所缓解。【原文：Japan's core consumer inflation probably slowed for a second straight month in April from a year earlier, a Reuters poll of 18 economists showed on Friday, likely easing cost-push pressure.】

item.title: 在美元坚挺和美联储不确定性的背景下，4月份外国人抛售亚洲债券
item.description: 由于美元走强和美联储降息的不确定性抑制了投资者的投资热情，4 月份外国投资者连续第二个月成为亚洲债券的净卖家。【原文：Foreign investors were net sellers of Asian bonds for a second straight month in April as a strong U.S. dollar and uncertainties around the Federal Reserve's interest rate cuts dampened appetite.】

item.title: ABB 收购西门子在中国的配线附件业务
item.description: 瑞士工程集团 ABB 周五表示，已同意收购德国竞争对手西门子在中国的配线附件业务。【原文：ABB has agreed to buy the wiring accessories business of German rival Siemens in China, the Swiss engineering group said on Friday.】

item.title: 波音离任首席执行官的董事会地位将于周五面临股东投票表决
item.description: 波音公司的股东将于周五投票决定即将离任的首席执行官戴夫-卡尔霍恩（Dave Calhoun）是否应继续留在董事会，这将为年度股东大会（AGM）增添新的亮点，预计投资者将在会上寻求明确这家飞机制造商未来的领导层。【原文：Boeing shareholders will vote on Friday whether outgoing CEO Dave Calhoun should remain on the board, adding intrigue to an annual general meeting (AGM) where investors are expected to seek clarity on future leadership of the planemaker.】

item.title: 道指攀升至创纪录的 40,000 点
item.description: 道琼斯工业平均指数（Dow Jones Industrial Average）是今年美国主要股指中的落后者，周四，它在历史上首次短暂突破 40,000 点，成为焦点。【原文：The Dow Jones Industrial Average , a laggard among the major U.S. stock indexes this year, got its moment in the spotlight on Thursday as it briefly broke above 40,000 points for the first time in its history.】

item.title: 早间竞价：市场思考加息路径，股价无精打采
item.description: 安库尔-班纳吉（Ankur Banerjee）对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee】

item.title: 通用汽车与 LG 就雪佛兰 Bolt 电动车电池故障问题达成 1.5 亿美元救济基金协议
item.description: 周四提交给美国法院的文件显示，通用汽车公司与韩国电池公司 LG Energy Solution 达成和解，将设立 1.5 亿美元的基金，为受缺陷电池影响的雪佛兰 Bolt 电动车车主提供金钱救济。【原文：General Motors and South Korean battery firm LG Energy Solution reached a settlement to establish a $150 million fund to provide monetary relief to Chevrolet Bolt EV owners who were affected by defective batteries, documents filed in a U.S. court on Thursday showed.】

item.title: 中国房地产开发商碧桂园香港清盘聆讯延期
item.description: 在中国政府努力重振受危机影响的房地产行业之际，香港一家法院周五将寻求清算碧桂园的呈请聆讯延期至 6 月 11 日，为这家陷入困境的中国开发商提供了喘息机会。【原文：A Hong Kong court adjourned to June 11 a hearing of a petition on Friday seeking liquidation of Country Garden , providing a breather to the embattled Chinese developer amid Beijing's efforts to revive the crisis-hit property sector.】

item.title: 中国新房价格以逾 9 年最快速度下跌
item.description: 中国 4 月份新房价格创下 9 年多来最快的月度降幅，使政府当局继续承受压力，因为加大力度扶持萎靡不振的房地产行业的努力几乎没有见效的迹象。【原文：China's new home prices fell at the fastest monthly pace in over nine years in April, keeping pressure on authorities as intensified efforts to prop up the ailing property sector show few signs of paying off.】

item.title: 微软为云客户提供 AMD 替代英伟达 AI 处理器
item.description: 微软周四表示，它计划为其云计算客户提供一个 AMD 人工智能芯片平台，该平台将与英伟达（Nvidia）生产的组件竞争，具体细节将在下周举行的 Build 开发者大会上公布。【原文：Microsoft said on Thursday it plans to offer its cloud computing customers a platform of AMD artificial intelligence chips that will compete with components made by Nvidia , with details to be given at its Build developer conference next week.】

item.title: 美国降息时间的不确定性导致亚洲股市放缓
item.description: 周五，亚洲股市走低，交易员们在思考近期美国货币政策的走向，此前美联储官员表示，即使通胀出现早期缓解迹象，利率也可能需要在更长时间内维持在较高水平。【原文：Asian stocks inched lower on Friday as traders pondered the near term U.S. monetary policy path after Federal Reserve officials suggested that interest rates may need to stay higher for longer even as inflation shows early signs of easing.】

item.title: 中国 4 月工业产值增长 6.7% 超预期
item.description: 随着制造业复苏步伐加快，中国 4 月份工业产值同比增长 6.7%，增速高于 3 月份的 4.5%。【原文：China's industrial output grew 6.7% year-on--year in April, accelerating from the 4.5% pace seen in March, as the recovery in the manufacturing sector gathered pace.】

item.title: 代理顾问 Glass Lewis 敦促赫斯股东接受雪佛龙收购要约
item.description: 代理顾问公司 Glass Lewis 周四表示，赫斯股东应在公司 5 月 28 日的特别会议上投票支持雪佛龙公司 530 亿美元的收购要约。【原文：Hess shareholders should vote in favor of Chevron Corp's $53 billion offer at the company's May 28 special meeting, proxy adviser Glass Lewis said on Thursday.】

item.title: 受美国经济放缓迹象影响，美元将出现周度下跌
item.description: 周五，美元兑欧元创下两个半月以来的最大单周跌幅，原因是通胀降温和美国经济疲软的迹象提高了降息的可能性。【原文：The dollar headed for its largest weekly fall versus the euro in two-and-a-half months on Friday as signs of cooling inflation and a softening U.S. economy raised the prospect of rate cuts.】

item.title: 需求出现改善迹象，石油将迎来周涨幅
item.description: 周五亚洲交易时段油价上涨，全球基准布伦特油价将在三周内首次上涨，原因是有迹象表明全球需求在改善，而且头号石油消费国美国的通胀在放缓。【原文：Oil prices rose in Asian trading hours on Friday, with global benchmark Brent set for its first weekly increase in three weeks on signs of improving global demand and slowing inflation in top oil consumer the United States.】

item.title: 文件称谷歌寻求在美国广告技术诉讼案中进行非陪审团审判
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司周四向法院提交了一份文件，要求对美国司法部指控这家广告和搜索巨头在网络广告市场中的反竞争行为的诉讼进行非陪审团审判。【原文：Alphabet's Google in a court filing on Thursday is seeking a non-jury trial in the U.S. Justice Department's lawsuit accusing the advertising and search giant of anticompetitive practices in the online advertising marketplace.】

item.title: 拜登签署全面航空安全和改革法案，使其成为法律
item.description: 乔-拜登总统周四签署了全面的航空立法，以增加美国空中交通管制员的人手，增加资金以避免跑道关闭事件，并加快取消航班的退款速度。【原文：President Joe Biden on Thursday signed sweeping aviation legislation to boost U.S. air traffic controller staffing, increase funding to avert runway close-call incidents and speed refunds for canceled flights.】

item.title: 工会为波音公司代表提供有关美国举报人法律的培训
item.description: 波音公司的一个工程工会周四表示，将首次为其代表提供有关美国举报人法律的培训，因为该工会担心其成员缺乏足够的保护，可能遭到报复。【原文：A Boeing engineering union said on Thursday it will offer its representatives training on U.S. whistleblower laws for the first time, following concerns that its members lack adequate protection against possible reprisals.】

item.title: 海底捞餐饮运营商 Super Hi 在美国的首次公开募股定价为每股 19.56 美元
item.description: 在海外市场经营中国连锁火锅店 "海底捞 "的 Super Hi International 周四将其在美国的首次公开募股定价为每股 19.56 美元。【原文：Super Hi International , which operates Chinese hotpot restaurant chain Haidilao in the overseas market, on Thursday priced its initial public offering in the United States at $19.56 per share.】

item.title: 早间竞价中国数据公布前市场情绪高涨
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 纽约市广播公司首席运营官卸任
item.description: 陷入困境的贷款机构纽约社区银行（New York Community Bancorp）周四表示，其首席运营官 Julie-Ann Signorille-Browne 已辞职，自 5 月 24 日起生效。【原文：Embattled lender New York Community Bancorp said on Thursday that its Chief Operating Officer Julie-Ann Signorille-Browne has resigned from her role, effective May 24.】

item.title: OpenAI 达成协议，将 Reddit 内容引入 ChatGPT
item.description: Reddit 与 OpenAI 周四表示，双方已合作将该社交媒体平台的内容引入流行的聊天机器人 ChatGPT，这使得 Reddit 的股价在盘中上涨了 12%。【原文：Reddit has partnered with OpenAI to bring the social media platform's content to popular chatbot ChatGPT, the companies said on Thursday, sending Reddit's shares up 12% in extended trade.】
